intro: Stylomecon, commonly known as the American bellflower, is a herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Stylomecon thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
